real_review: as small cheval is to au cheval, pqm is to publican, little goat is to girl & goat...SideDoor is to Lawrys.if you are in this area, do not pass this place up.  it's a hidden gem tucked inside of the infamous Lawry's Prime Rib.you can get the rib for under $20, Lamb chops, pot pie, the wedge salad, caesar of course, and what i got for a mere $4...PRIME RIB CHILI.  Lawry's prime rib.i had to get a bowl to go.  i also chowed the brussels sprout salad with some amazing jumbo shrimp.  & brought home half.the dessert menu was filled with vintage delights including the famous lawry's belgian chocolate chest.this place is definitely special.  it's hard to beat in this area.  huge thumbs up.

Came here on a Friday night and was left with nothing but great food and great service. I had planned an engagement dinner for a friend and they were able to accommodate 9 people comfortably and the server John was exceptional. He was very attentive and made suggestions on the menu which all came out amazing. Food wise: The Thai curry wings were amazing with a fine peanut butter spread to top it off. The prime rib was very juicy and full of flavor.All in all awesome place to grab a bite with friends or just come for a quick lunch. If you can recommend a server definitely ask for John. Thanks Side door

Disappointed with this place. I saw it on here and thought the pictures looked great. It's name is perfect. You go in the little side door to the prime rib place attached. It has all the hallmarks of a great place in the beginning. Low ceiling, darkish lighting, small bar area with lots of wood. Sets up for a nice atmosphere. I just couldn't bring myself to order anything in particular from the menu. I tried the avocado mash with pita chips which was basically guacamole with a pretentious name. I love a good bourbon and they had a good selection but you couldn't get a good glass on the rocks for less than 14. It was definitely overpriced. 500 yard away I can get the same bourbon, still have great food and atmosphere for a much better price. I thought about giving it the benefit of the doubt but at $19 for a main when there isn't anything you really like the look of, hard to justify. Two stars for atmosphere but you lose the rest of them with the prices.

Side door is literally a side door into the Lawry's bar and lounge/ causal dining room. They have their own host to seat you and wait staff ready to serve you. It's totally causal, the wait staff are dressed in t-shirt and causal pants to show the difference between them and Lawry's restaurant. A causal side to Lawry's with a moderate price point for the ones wanting a little bit of Lawry's without having get prime rib.We had a great time chillin at Side door and celebrating a good friend's birthday. We ordered drinks and some burgers. I had the " side door cheese burger" and my husband had their prime rib burger that comes with some house made chips. We also order side of white truffle fries it was really good. I love shoe

Very cool entrance... side door to a prominent steak house!  Great beer selection!!  I thought the Solemn Oath Brewery's Punk Rock For Rich Kids Belgium beer was perhaps one of the best I have ever tasted!!  Bartender was attentive and entertaining.  I had a wedge blue cheese salad that did not disappoint! Defiantly recommend checking out this cool establishment!

Nice little casual spot in the heart of River North. It's a little pricey yea but it's the area. I tried some of the steak which was really good, and then 2 cocktails and a beer that I liked. They had a good craft beer list, had one that I hadn't had before. And the cocktails I had tasted good and weren't too strong. It's attached to Lawry's if I am not mistaken.

Overall good food but our abrasive waiter ruined the experience for us. Probably won't be back anytime soon. Kind of a bummer I'm rating it so low, as previous visits in the past were definitely four star worthy. Anyways, Sidedoor is a classy feeling gastropub serving up premium meats from Lawry's and an awesome selection of really limited beers on taps. For food this last visit, we started with Lobster Bruschetta ~ tomatoes, garlic oil, grilled Ciabatta, I did the Rib House Sandwich ~ caramelized onions, tarragon aioli, and for the fiancée the Fork and Knife Pastrami Sandwich ~ house made pastrami, rarebit, house made giardiniera, pretzel roll. The food was great and flavors were excellent. Service... It all started when our waiter took our order. My fiancée was simply asking if it was possible to sub out the side of chips for a side salad or something else, but was met with a very rude "EVERYTHING IS A LA CARTE" as an answer. Umm, okay cool dude. He never bothered to check up on us, and what really rubbed me the wrong way was when he asked the table next to us if they cared for a dessert menu then came by our table and tossed us the bill as we barely finished up. Rude.'Til next time.

I don't know what I did to evoke such a rude demeanor from the blond waiter working this past Saturday night, but man oh man was I taken back by his attitude!My fiance and I dropped in around 7pm on Saturday night. Sidedoor was busy. No surprise given the Magnificent Mile Lights Festival going on.We sat down and the waiter came by and took our order. I was in the process of ordering a sandwich when I thought to ask the guy "is there anything I can sub out for the side? It comes with chips, right?" To which he answered "Yeah. Chips." So I asked him, "is there anything I can sub out on the side, like a side salad or something?" He scowled. "You could order a salad. Everything here is a la carte." ..seriously? I've been to restaurants where they haven't allowed substitutions and really, it's not a big deal. But this guy was just snarky. I brushed it off.We had sat down around the same time as another couple next to us, with the same waiter waiting on that table. I hear him fawning over them "Oh, do you want a dessert? We make our key lime pie in house! It's soooo good!!" We were just finishing up our entrees, and was expecting him to at least offer a dessert menu, but nope - as he was fawning over the table next to us, he doesn't even make eye contact, and throws a bill on our table - doesn't say a word and walks away.It was so bizarre and odd.

Atmosphere over-lit and awkwardly arrayed.Ultimately no there there. Expensive food options and lack of cohesion undermined the experience.Felt like a waiting room that someone had stuck a few tables in.

I love the side door . It is like a causal Lawrys . The menu is fun and they change it from time to time which is always a fun surprise . The food is delicious and I like the drinks they have . It's a nice , cute restaurant very quaint and intimate . The service was really great as well . The side door is a great place to dine at while downtown . It's a nice place to stop in !

Stopped in for lunch. Scott is a great waiter!! Was waiting for all tables seated and kept up with all of us. Food was delicious, even down to the coleslaw!! Portions are generous. Open viewing of your food being prepared!
I love this place. They have the best cocktails made by professional and courteous staff. I especially like Dylan. He is friendly, knowledgeable and professional. He is a definite asset to Side Door!

Was really looking forward to trying this place based on all the reviews but was somewhat disappointed by the food. We ordered the prime rib sandwich which was good but the pastrami sandwich was unbelievably salty and inedible.

Great place for drinks and small plates just off the hustle and bustle of Michigan Ave. We came here as we just got to town for drinks and appetizers. Great beer, wine, and cocktail selection. The avocado smash might be glorified guacamole but it's very good as well as the corn fritters and IPA pretzels.

It was quiet and pleasant on a Tuesday afternoon. Cocktails were absolutely awesome. Food looks good- we came just for cocktails. Great service too and the inside is unusual. I would definitely return.

Here are my ratings!EXPECTATIONS: Kind of small place. Great selection of beer, liquor, and cocktails! Awesome service before stepped a food in this place! SERVICE: 5CLEANLINESS: 5QUALITY OF FOOD: n/aQUALITY OF DRINKS: 5AMBIANCE: Casual/Upscale, the quality of drinks are worth the price but don't think you can come in here with 20 bucks for drinks! Dim lighting, dark wood, it has a soft feel!OVERALL: Overall, awesome service! Great drinks! Unfortunately, we couldn't stay longer because we had a dinner reservation to catch but our server Elliot, I believe, was fantastic! Great conversationalist! TIP: Try their cocktails!

Great experience at Side Door! We were anticipating coming in with a larger group of 8. We called in advance, and they noted that they do not take reservations but that there was a minimal wait. When we arrived 30 minutes later, they had a table prepared for us! We started with drinks, and there was a decent and unique beer selection. A few of the group ordered the carving boards. The portions were small and came with a few toppings that did not substantiate being called sides. They all noted that the boards were delicious and would order them again. I had the wedge salad and corn chowder, both of which were delicious. Both the lobster mac 'n cheese and shepherd's pie were devoured by those who ordered them. The only miss of the night was the ribs, which my mom thought were chewy and fatty. Overall would highly recommend!

I grew up in Los Angeles in the 1960s, so I have fond memories of the original Lawry's and CC Browns Ice Cream Parlor. But I'm rarely in the mood for a complete prime rib dinner, so I was interested in trying the Side Door, since it is essentially the bar for Lawry's Chicago.Side Door bills themselves as a gastropub, but to me that implies more eclectic and gourmet food than you'll find here. This is basically bar food, with an emphasis on hamburgers, sandwiches, and some large salads.Of course, the most popular item--and the one I tried--is the prime rib sandwich. It was served on the kind of roll you'd get with a French Dip, and with the same au jus, so it was essentially a Prime Rib French Dip, and a good one at that. The prime rib was perfectly medium rare, very tender, and expertly trimmed.Since the sandwich contains 7 ounces of prime rib it seems a far better deal than their meat plates, which cost the same but contain a mere 4 ounces of meat.I also tried the curried cauliflower which was good, if a bit dry.There's a substantial selection of beers with an emphasis on stouts--a list after my own heart!The space is divided into two rooms, one a bit too brightly lit, where the meat is prepared, and the other with the typical bar TVs.Service was extremely gracious and attentive.
Their Creekstone pastrami sandwich was very tasty! It was salty, but totally worth it. Try their lobster mac n cheese. You won't regret it!

I would come back to this gorgeous space for cocktails, but probably not food. Three of us went out for cocktails and small bites. The food and cocktail menus change ever few weeks, so don't bother looking online beyond to get a feel for what they offer. Drinks wise, I went for an apple brandy concoction called The Big Apple and it was delicious. On the food front we ordered scalloped potatoes, Stilton Mac and Cheese, sticky toffee pudding and the ice cream sundae. None of it stood out, although the sundae was probably the best of the bunch. At these prices, I want more than mediocre food (potatoes were nearly flavorless, as was the mac if you didn't get the crumbles on top). Our waiter was a charming dude named J.P. who got a pretty good sense of our ordering rhythm after taking a bit long for one of our drinks. It was nearly empty on the weekday we went, and I would be willing to try the cocktails again if I needed a place to bring a larger group.

This review is for a quick lunch- a very lovely quick lunch, indeed. I came to SideDoor for a meeting last week and was welcomed by a friendly server, seating me at a levitated table past the bar. This GORGEOUS space (same restaurant family as Lawry's, housed in the historic McCormick mansion along Michigan Avenue) has an ambiance for a comfortable yet classy lunch, with a straightforward menu featuring many enticing eats.I enjoyed the prime rib chili (amazing) and the most beautiful wedge salad I have ever seen. It was the perfect amount, and I even saved a bit of my salad for later in the afternoon.I hope to head to Lawry's soon for the famous table side prime rib dinner!
Friendly staff, big portions, great atmosphere. If you're going to get beer make sure you order the flight to try out.

We had dinner  tonight at Side Door. I was pleased with our service. Sadly there was one waiter for the entire dining room. Granted it's not a big place, but another person would have been helpful.  Our waiter did the best he could under the circumstances. He even kept refilling our water long after the bill was paid.  That was the good part of our visit. The bad was the food. I had corn chowder.  It was barely warm. My entree was a pastrami sandwich. It was also cool and really greasy. I have never eaten at Lawrys and assumed this food was comparable. I was wrong. The other folks at my table weren't overly impressed with their food either. There are too many good places in the area for dinner. Sadly this is not one I will return to in the future.

Decent place, but probably won't be back.Food was good, but not worth the price. The meat plate (lamb, filet, prime rib) was tasty, but the meat was overly salty (I love flavor, but when served with multiple sauce/toppings the meat shouldn't be overly salted). The lobster mac & cheese was tasty but liquidy.  Service was very average, had to look around and ask other staff for orders multiple times.  I'm not sad we ate there, but have had better meals for half the price.

When a visit to the purple pig was thwarted  because of being closed for redecorating we ended up here.Nice cozy gentlemen club atmosphere...think high back chairs and lots of suits.  We tried a couple local beers and decided on the housemade corned beef sandwich with a yummy rarebit  and grainy mustard on a pretzel roll. Very tasty.We also got the poutine with chorizo gravy. Talk about a seriously good lunch.Prices were pretty fair for the area. Our server turned out to be a friend of our mayor back home in st. Pete so we had a great time speaking to him as well.I'd come back on my next trip north.

We wanted to do steak at least once in chicago, but this presents a problem since I'm not of the meat eating variety of people. Side door seemed like a good compromise, steakhouse, yet still had some veggie options. Not to mention, multiple friends had recommended it. We had just spent them day walking around downtown chicago, so I guess we might have been a tad underdressed, but the staff didn't blink and led us to a table in the corner with two armchairs. Super comfy seating if I may say so. Granted, those seemed to be the only two arm chairs in the room, but whatever. Our server came over and explained the meat cutting board. After careful deliberation by my fiance, he decided on just the prime rib, I got the mac and cheese and the deviled eggs, and our server was super nice to make sure I could eat it. The eggs were really good. mac and cheese was really good too. But sorry sidedoor, we had Fork's mac and cheese the other day, and I was spoiled by that. My fiance, who had been a little apprehensive about his steak when it was set down in front of him, said it was the most amazing piece of meat. His steak came with friends and horseradish. I preferred the spicy horseradish to the mild one, but hey, different strokes. We thought about dessert, and then we just way too full to even consider it. Loved the decor, loved the pillar in the bathroom, loved the key motif.

Fabulous dinner! Impeccable service and the entrees are delicious. We enjoyed the Prime Rib sandwich (best I've ever had), Shepard pie, mac and cheese (minus lobster for my 6yr old) and my daughter enjoyed the fish and chips.  Definitely coming back
Stopped here for a cocktail after shopping and sight seeing all day. Cute "side door" entrance. Great list of cocktail choices.

Came in on a Monday for lunch.  We were sat in the front portion of the restaurant which only had four occupied tables who were finishing up their meals.  After seeing many great reviews I was looking forward to trying this place out.  For our entrees we ordered the pastrami sandwich and shepherd's pie.  The sandwhich came out about 12 minutes prior to the shepherd's pie and that after it sat under the heat lamp for a good five minutes. The bottom bun was soaked in grease.  I had to clean my hands after every bite I took.  The best part about the entree was the coleslaw.  They had a different spin on it than what I am accustomed to.  It was creamy yet tangy at the same time.  I could've had that as a meal all by itself.  The shepherd's pie was good, but not sure if I'd order it again.  Overall the service was mediocre and food below par.  With the restaurant being as slow as it was, I don't know why the cook fell behind on the order.  I am also wondering if they were short staffed that day too, as there were multiple tables that were left uncleaned.  It wasn't till almost the time that we left that they were cleared of the remnants from the previous patrons.

I will preface this review with the fact that we caught them on a bad day. Despite that, I have to review based on my experience and, unfortunately, it was a bad one. Typically, I would start with the pros, but because there were so few of them, I will begin with the cons.CONS-Limited Seating. We arrived a little bit before 1pm on Saturday with 11 people. It was clear that they did not have the space for us, but they moved some round barter tables together in an area outside of the dining room to accommodate. It was awkward, but I guess it worked.-Long wait time for food. A few people straggled in late, but we did not wait for them to order. So then, how is it that the latecomers were served before us? All of our food came out a different times, so different, that I had to eat my meal before it got cold and I was done with my meal before my fiancé was even served. -Incorrect orders. If the wait time wasn't bad enough, when they finally started bringing out food, the wrong items were coming out. We had to send back at least 5 things. A few people got the right thing, but prepared wrong, but we had waited so long for the food, it wasn't worth complaining to send it back just to wait another hour for their food.-Where is my water??? It was bad enough I had to ask, it was worse that I had to ask for a water refill on the same empty glass four times. -Where is my waiter??? We had 11 people at our table and we barely saw our waiter. We had more visits by more waiters and a manager by the end of our visit.-Bagged salad. Need I say more?PROS-Had my food come out on time, my burger would have been really good. Unfortunately, it was cold so I didn't enjoy it to the fullest.-Because of our bad experience, they comped our meal and 2 rounds of drinks. However, they made us pay for our first round of drinks...at that point, why would you make us pay for anything??BOTTOM LINEI'll never know if this dining experience was a fluke or the norm, because I'm never going back.

Looong wait times, drinks coming out after dinner was finished, over cooked burger, grisly beef sandwich, but my sister Loved the beef and barley soup and the lobster mac and cheese. The side of French fries were well seasoned. Steakhouse atmosphere without the pretentiousness.I would have rather gone to Hub51 or Quartino for similar prices and better service.

Nice lunch spot, happened to be across the street from my hotel, I had the prime rib sandwich, cole slaw and we shared a lobster Mac and cheese.  The sandwich was awesome, definitely one the best I have had in my travels. Lobster Mac was the best I have had with decent chunks of lobster and the perfect baked crunch on top.  Potato chips were some of the best ever as well, coleslaw was not my thing but colleagues enjoyed it.  Overall this was an excellent lunch and I'd recommend lunch or dinner here at Side Door.  Enjoy.

This is a very nice alternative to the expensive and crowded Lawry's steak house next door.  The Side Door is part of the Lawry's chain but is indeed a separate restaurant, although connected to the steak house through the Side Door's bar area.  The bar itself is warm, welcoming, and snug, with a nice selection of beers and cocktails.  The meats (i.e. prime rib and others) served at Side Door are from the adjacent Lawry's and carved in the Side Door's prep area.  I lunched on an excellent prime rib sandwich au jus with home-made chips. Tender juicy slices, medium-rare, a real treat.  I also had an appetizer of sauteed peppers in a vinegar sauce, which wasn't too spicy, and a nice accompaniment to the prime rib.  On another visit for dinner, I had a slab of prime rib (they can give you the classic prime rib steak instead of in a sandwich upon request) which was equally satisfying; in addition, their sides of haricots verts and roasted cauliflower were also very good renditions.  We shared appetizers of their calamari, pretzel bites (cloud soft inside!), and lobster bruschetta (very very good; i want more please) which were all well executed.  All in all, a great option and experience when you want a more informal meal and good eats!
Good food for the price.  Wedge salad, lobster mac and cheese and grilled cheese sandwich with tomato bisque were excellent.

Presidents' Day weekend with +70 degrees, so when we got there we were warned at the door that they'd been hit hard and we almost out of Prime Rib. We went in for a drink anyway.  Some one else came from the kitchen, seeking us out, saying thy could indeed accommodate us. Had the meat board and Caesar salad.  EXCELLENT!

Went on a random weeknight for dinner. The dining room is nicely decorated - this place looks and feels upscale. I had the whiskey cocktail that had chocolate bitters - it was a really good and unique drink. For food I had the pastrami sandwhich - I thought it was good but not great. The pastrami had a tough and chewy texture at times - isn't pastrami supposed to be tender? Overall, I enjoyed the meal but not sure if anything is going to draw me back.
Food was great. Service was fast and excellent. We will definitely come back when we are here again.

Perfect! I just had there mansion burger ..O.M.G.!Delicious, but be sure your hungry if you order it.Sat at the bar as I was dinning alone, very friendly staff. The  3 cheese Mac n cheese with Apple wood smoked bacon and tomato is first rate!! Do it

Food 5-stars. Salty, creamy heaven. Not sure I've had a pastrami sandwich that was so good. As good as Dillmans.Atmosphere 4-stars. Kitchen-meets-cool-kids-hunting-lodge vibe with a literal tortoise shell, tile floor, dark wood, mini-antler theme thing going on. During dinner it was half-full and music was low enough there were times it felt too quiet, like others were listening in. Service 2.5-stars. Inattentive, long waits and poor timing. This was for beers, waiting for order, etc.You'll see this same theme on most other reviews I've now noticed. That's why Yelp is great. Tells it like it is.Well curated draft beer selection was $10-11 for 12-oz pour, so that's high even for the city. Definitely River North pricing.

Based on service, no food- because that's potentially what we should have had- I wish I had 4 hands to give them 4 thumbs down. We (3 women and 1 man well dressed for the night) walk in- no hostess at Sidedoor- walk over to Lawry's side- bump into a young man who mentioned he is supposed to seat us. Okay- no problem.We get seated. Water gets poured right away- awesome. Waitress asks if we had been here before- we havent- gives us the menu run down. Perfect.10 minutes passed- we watch her serve 3 other parties of 2 - avoiding our tables frantically. We see her venting to the chefs in the back about to what seems to be about kitchen? It is 8:45pm when they close 10. We wanted to place our order as soon as possible. 15 minutes pass- nothing. We decide to Yelp other places- Beacon Tavern looked promising (we decided on Howells and Hood- find my review on their page). We decide to leave- we look at the back of the room-4 men in a huddle- one which was the hostess. My man friend kindly asks if their kitchen is closing- the hostess says "we're not closed, we're just not busy" perfect answer for such lacking service.Skip the mess and go somewhere that makes you feel welcomed, happy, and confident in giving your hard earned business.Wish we had a chance to try the food. Sure its good with the Lawry name tied to it...

Got their chicken sandwich that was very tender and seasoned well. My dad got the burger that he also enjoyed, nothing special though. Get the side of fries, they are sooooo good and huge! If you like them heavily salted and skinny. The decor on the inside was very warm and well spread out with two levels. You can look down at the old fashioned bar, with overall great low lighting and a amazing fire place. Didn't get any drinks but they looked delicious. Service was attentive, personal, and not overwhelming!

I should have left this review right after I ate there (this was WEEKS ago), because I'm not sure I'll do it justice now! It was literally the best burger I've ever had, hands down. This deliciously juicy, perfectly (medium-rare) cooked, wonder of a burger was placed in front of me. I'd asked for avocado to be added and it was perfectly ripe and creamy. Now, you must be made aware that I am NOT a pickle fan. I've never taken to pickles in burgers or out. I had read in the description that there were pickles on this burger and made a mental note to ask for no pickles (as per usual). Apparently my hungry mind over-ran my mouth and decided to forget to ask for this small modification. But boy am I glad I forgot! When the burger arrived, pickles were gone from my mind, I had completely forgotten that they were in the burger. I bit into it and discovered how truly awesome this burger was....it was delectable! I got through half the burger in no time. I thought, wow, I can taste all the flavors and textures so effortlessly. From the soft pretzel bun to the juicy meat and creamy cheese, I was loving it ALL. Well, on my way through the second half, I realize with a small gasp of shock that I had eaten and ENJOYED pickles! These house-made, tasty, crispy pieces were tasty to me. That's what made me realize this was the perfect burger. They made me love (their) pickles. Can't wait to dine here again!

Ordered ribeye sandwich, wedge salad and French fries. Ribeye was ok. Wedge salad was not good. Expected the bacon to be crispy not stale. Fries were stale and cold. Very disappointed. I really wanted to like this place.

Really a fan of this place. Prices are good, food quality is amazing, and portions are decent. I especially think the wedge salad is a great deal! It has 4 fist-sized lettuce halves loaded with bacon and cheese to be comfortably shared among 4 people. For the meats the carver's trio is a great deal and we just ordered two to try every meat they had on the menu. The hanger steak is my favorite and whatever they marinate that stuff in is simply amazing! The prime ribs were so soft they melted in my mouth... Do check your bill tho. We caught two errors in ours and apparently they just switched to a new system and glitches like this happen often. Not a good sign.

I stopped by here on my lunch and grabbed the roast beef sandwich. It was good to go, but I think it would've been better dining in. The meat was tender and tasty. Even after walking back, the meat was not dried out. If definitely go back next time I'm in Chicago.

Side Door is a fine gastro-pub but I really wasn't blown away.  Atmosphere is classy and the service was pleasant, but i just didn't think the food was great.  I had the Chicago Beef, which was the server's recommendation.  It was fine -- a little bland and nondescript. My friend had the prime rib, which was good but not great.  Saving the place is its beer menu, which is filled with exotic and well thought out choices. My suggestion is that you go here for the beer and atmosphere and temper your dining expectations.
The cocktails here are unique and well crafted and all of the bartenders have cute butts ;)

I love this place! I feel so cozy here, the food is amazing and what a great place for drinks! It is a great location and the food was really good. We had great service, with great atmosphere and one of our go to places for drinks.

As I sit here on the tarmac, waiting for American Airlines to give up trying to juke their stats and get us out of Chicago and back to Atlanta, my mind wanders back to the best prime rib I've ever had... which was not at Side Door.Last night (weds) I paid 35$ for one of the driest cuts of prime rib I've ever had... like a hockey puck, only less taste. Thankfully they had an awesome beer menu filled with sours and saisons which was unfortunately not quite enough to overcome the complete garbage that was their prime rib.

SideDoor continues to wow me with its well-appointed decor and excellent waitstaff - this time around we enjoyed the luscious deviled eggs, a fantastic Belgian quadruple at the recommendation of our server, fresh and crunchy rapini and asparagus, bacon-rich Brussels sprouts, and two different prime rib sandwiches.

I had been to side door before and had an okay experience. Decided to go back for a late night bite to eat and it was very unsatisfying. We both had the burger as there were not many options. They were out of half of the small bite options. Half way through my burger I found a balled up piece of plastic wrap hanging out of my burger. When I told the waiter he asked if I wanted another and I was so disgusted I did not and told him to take it off the bill.  I was very disappointed that nothing was done to address this issue especially at a restaurant like Lawry's.  No manager came over to apologize.  I will never go back to Sidedoor.  It is a sad excuse to be associated with a top restaurant.

SideDoor is a place I will keep going back to because I will definitely hanker the beef sandwich on a regular basis.  You need to go up stairs to get in the (side) door (I bet there is a separate handicap entrance, but it is not the main way in). My first impression when I walked in was old time dark wood vibe, but more casual and welcoming. My partner had a delicious burger, and my gin and tonic was spot on.  Our service was impeccable, but not intrusive.  I will be back!

Sidedoor is a quiet bar, just off Rush and Ontario, adjacent to Lawry's Steakhouse. While I visited on a weeknight, the place never got busy with only a few patrons trickling in as others trickled out. I ordered the blend off the white wine menu and enjoyed it. I doubt that I would return here of my own volition, and would much rather direct others to far better alternatives in the vicinity.

Long day, delayed flight in to CHI, fighting off a cold, waaah.   I was concerned about the reviews around service and wait times, but it is literally across the street from my hotel. I was greeted and seat immediately by a hostess.  My waiter Jonathan was at the table with my water.Ordered the wedge salad and prime rib sandwich and both came out quickly.   Food was good and up to par for the Lawery's name.Maybe I lucked out at 6pm on a Tues night or someone has been paying attention to the reviews.  Service was spot on and fast.

Had dinner in lounge area. The few tables in the booth area is quite nice and comfortable. You can watch tv or eavesdrop on conversations at the bar. It's casual here, but if you like to dress up, go ahead. Anyway, their beer draught menu lists beer from light to dark with probably 4 IL brews and rest from California to Maine. Bottle list is a bit longer with more options for cider, sours and IIPAs. You can do flights of 4 for $16.The menu is simple yet delicious. There's definitely "bar" food like fish&chips, lettuce wraps, and wings, but if your appetite wants something more "elegant", go for the roasted meat boards. I'd recommend the braised pork belly - its crispy outer edges surrounding melt-in-your-mouth fatty layers and moist meat covered in a sauce that's full of umami goodness!!! I'm drooling just thinking about it even though I just had it like 5 min ago! I had the Lawry's wedge and it was good too. 5 mini wedges with chopped egg whites, crumbled blue cheese and beef bacon. I haven't tried dessert, but I did save my last sample of a beer flight for last: "Not your father's root beer", ABV 10.7! And they can make this into a root beer float!If you want some quietness, come around 5-6, but it'll start to pickup around 7. And this is a Saturday.
Love the atmosphere, very charming and festive! We even had Christmas Carols! Drinks are very good and loved the small bites! Great place to hang out on a cold night

We went here for dinner one night.  We were just looking for a place to eat in this area, and Yelp helped me find this place.  I got the pastrami sandwich.  Let me tell you, the menu says these are knife and fork sandwiches, they aren't kidding. Mine was very good.  We also got some chili and a plate of Mac and cheese which were both very good.  None of the food here comes with a side, so be warned.  Also, the place is a bit expensive.  Sandwiches from $14-19, entrees start around 16 and go into the 30s or higher.  The share the kitchen with Lawry's so that's probably why.  Also, their cheapest beer was $8 or $9.  If not for the prices, I'd give it 5 stars.

My husband and some friends of ours got into The City late and were looking for a good meal. We happened upon this restaurant and went in to the left (the restaurant on the right is The Lawry). Great drinks, gourmet food and staff that is knowledgeable in their job.

In the fantasy episode of Check, Please! that exists only in my dreams, I get to explain how I feel my pick has a certain gravitas, coming from the manager of one of the city's best sandwich spots (I am the manager of Xoco.)My favorite sandwich in Chicago is found here at Sidedoor: the prime rib sandwich.  There's nothing quite like the combo of prime rib, horseradish, softly-toasted bread and jus!  Today was one of my first outings since last fall, a picture perfect spring day in the sixties, blue skies, birds chirping.Here it's my day off, it's early afternoon and I am already back home from an amazing lunch (prime rib sandwich, handmade Idaho potato chips,  lemonade because I don't drink although they have a fantastic craft beer and cocktail list, excellent service from Scott who talked about Game of Thrones, creme brûlée) with an extra prime rib sandwich to-go in the fridge, kicked back in my chair by the breezy window, digesting delicious Lawry's prime rib, my brow slightly moist from the meat sweats.

My hubby first stopped in solo as I lay at nearby Northwestern recovering from surgery. He fell madly in love with the hard to find IPS Maine Beer Co "Another One" on tap and dragged me back after a follow up appt. the Maine beer was no longer on tap but we stayed for lunch. Prime rib sandwich was nice but ordered medium rare and came out very rare. Salads were nicely done and the little bar eating was great with cool posh booths! Very nice place to grab lunch and a drink. Note-this is the bar of Lawrys restaurant.

Across the street, too easy. This place is super dark and has an old school vibe. We like to sit at the bar and share a meat platter and the wedge. The wedge is amazing! The prime rib and turkey are my favs on the platter. The turkey is so juicy, which was surprising! The sandwiches are over the top and huge, but worth every bite. The beer list is pretty extensive as well. Overall a solid place to grab a brew and get your meat fix!

We popped in here for dinner on July 4. We were some  of the only guests in the place shortly after we arrived.... Everyone seemed to be heading to the fireworks. That being said the service was excellent, the food was excellent,  and they were even happy to accommodate a modification to the Sea Bass to substitute the olive oil for the dairy (dairy allergy). The chef came out personally to make sure it came out well, as it was the first time he prepared it that way. The lamb chops were super as well. Bar cocktails were average,  but nothing that made us want to order another round. We would definately come back,  though we would probably have drinks elsewhere before.

My review of Side Door - business traveler dining alone during early dinner hours.The good: Ambiance is great. Beautifully, elegantly decorated. Mood lighting, music. All great. The ok: Food. I tried the deviled eggs, wedge salad, and pork poutine. Eggs were good, nothing wrong just not the best I've had. Same with the salad. A unique flavored wedge, not typical of other wedges. But good. Poutine had a unique flavor. I'd pass on those the next time. The UGLY: Servers and staff are awful!!! I was here early dinner (5pm) and was nearly alone in the restaurant. Listened to two bartenders talk loudly with one another about people they have slept with. Then, another staff member joined them complaining about a customer from earlier in the day. Saying "it doesn't matter, I have two other job offers on the table". My server attempted to be friendly, but was awkward and slow at best. I am not a picky customer - but hearing about sex, bad customers and receiving slow service (when not busy) don't come close to meeting my needs. I would not return based on awful staff!!

Well at least the décor is great!  Was excited to pop in and try their food and cocktails.  Well We never got past the cocktails.  We sat and waited for 15 minutes before anyone approached us for a drink order.  Placed our drink order (a glass of wine and a Sapphire and tonic) which took 10 minutes to get.  Then never saw our server again.  We wanted to order food.  We wanted to order more drinks.  Never got the opportunity.  Customer service is not their priority.  Oh and there were about 10 people in the bar.  So it is not like it was packed.  We were completely disappointed.  Go there for the décor, but don't bother to order anything.  No one seems to care.

The Side Door is a great place for wonderful sandwiches.  My son is going to school in Chicago and we discovered it when we were touring the campus last summer.  We returned in October when I was there on a business trip.  The pastrami sandwich is his favorite while I love the prime rib sandwich.

Fantastic restaurant. The food, the drinks, the service, and even the quirky atmosphere were all great. The wife and I split the fish and chips, best I've had and I'm usually not a fan. I had the corn chowder which was excellent and if you like deviled eggs and spice, order them. It's not cheap, but it is worth it. The avocado mash was pretty good too, but it was a little brown.

Love this place! The prime rib sandwich is amazing and it's never too busy. Great lunch spot also. They were training people and service was a little slow during a recent visit but Laura H went out of her way to make sure we were taken care of even though we weren't in her section. Her going above and beyond when there was a service need was great and turned an original service mishap into a great experience.

Old school Chicago vibes and good times.Tucked away on the side of the McCormick Mansion by Lawry's Prime Rib, SideDoor can easily missed. I came here with family when first arriving to Chicago. We did happy hour at Purple Pig and came here for some dinner. We all LOVED it. Great comfort food that keeps you satisfied if you're going to be taking in the Chicago nightlife.I recommend the Wildfire cocktail, the Avocado Mash, the Baked Mac n Cheese and the Lawry's Prime Rib Sandwich. However, you really can't go wrong here!

The concept of this restaurant is great, tasty all American food with some flair (in the back of a nice steak house) at prices that don't carry the responsibility of the pomp and circumstance in the main dining room. For everything that the food was (it was seriously pretty good), the service was the opposite. I don't mind that all of the dishes came out at different times because that fits with the concept but after 45 minutes of everyone else having eaten my wife's entree had still not come out, to the waiters apology he admitted he forgot it. While taking orders he tried to be impressive and not write anything down... And clearly it wasn't a winning strategy. To make matters worse when he went to fill a glass of water, he shattered another glass and little shards went everywhere. He didn't even offer to replace the desert or other drinks on that side of the table which could have had glass in them. This ended our eating and drinking portion of the meal prematurely. The icing on the cake was when we heard an employee at the bar saying to a co worker very loudly-- "man I only got $100 in tips tonight, this sucks"..... Overall a pretty good restaurant that needs some serious staff training.

Came here for the first time for dinner during the weekday around 8pm and the place was very empty. I got the burger (medium) with avocado and bacon which was delicious! Highly recommend this place if you want to catch up with friends with great food.

I like this place. I've been a couple of times when in Chicago. A friend and I went their for an early dinner prior to some shopping and a show. The restaurant is quaint and the staff were all friendly. I wanted to order a beer but the prices were RIDICULOUS!! The food was good, especially the homemade chips. I had a chicken sandwich. My friend had the cheeseburger. While the cheeseburger was super flavorful and cooked perfectly, it was SO salty she couldn't eat it. The waiter was great. He refunded the amount of the burger. So, I gave this a 3 rating because of the burger and the ridiculously priced beer.
The food was amazing. The tenderloin melted in my mouth. No joke, teeth were optional.

My friends and I went to the SideDoor last Saturday to celebrate our reunion after about 4 years. The place was really nice and our server was so funny! I usually don't order sandwiches as I was never able to finish any sandwich for one meal. However, I ordered Prime Rib Sandwich last time and I FINISHED IT ALL!!! That was definitely the best sandwich I've ever had.
Amazing!!! I was in town for a conference and decided to roam. Amazing beer and even better food!

The key will lead you in.. I saw this emblem and knew I had to eat here. I figured that they'd have some kind of need for reservation but they didn't, we could literally walk right in and be seated! My party was seated in a neat little room next to a meat shaver, we got to watch the meat being prepared. The decor was amazing, the tile in the room looked like black and white woven material, the walls were blood red with art on them. The sconces and chandeliers were incredible. I wanted to move in. Then there was the food. We started with the fried pickles and the husband ordered a wedge salad. The portions were huge.. And the taste was incredible.  My husband and our friend both ordered a hamburger and I ordered the prime rib sandwich.. HOLY CRAP these were HUGE.. None of us finished, but all of us were satisfied with what he ended up with.And the coffee & service were spot on.

Wow. This place was awesome. Great location, east to get to, and great service.Went to Side Door for a late lunch. We ordered the meat trio with leg of lamb, prime rib & steak. All meats were very good. Platter came with fried onion crisps & various sauces.We ordered duck confit potatoes which were whole potatoes with duck - very tasty.Finally we ordered pretzel bites - these were good. They came with some sort of mustard sauce.The service was great! Our waitress was very attentive - checked on us every 10 minutes or so. He food came out super quick. I swear it was like we ordered it, and it appeared! I would have liked everything to come out slower honestly. We ordered so much food, and it all came out at once, it was a little overwhelming.The bar service was also very quick. I ordered a beer and in a matter of minutes it was at my table.The restaurant is very nice looking & clean. It was quiet & they have a little nook that has 2 tables in it, very nice!

Came by recently for the $5 burger they were offering due to Yelp Burger WeekThe place is located within Lawry's Prime Rib hence the name Side Door. Me and my buddies walked in and no one was at the front which caused us to kind of wander around in hope to find someone. We saw a guy that happened to walk behind the bar and he told us he could get someone for us.We got an awesome server that continued to make jokes and was really interactive and helpful with the menu...pretty cool actually. I went with the $5 burger which was an angus beef patty with iceberg lettuce, pickled red onion and gruyère cheese (my choice of cheese). I enjoyed the burger very much and would buy it again for its regular price. My buddy got The Roger which is pastrami, gruyère cheese, caramelized onions, horseraddish mayo on sourdough...it looked very good. Pretty cool spot and good food as well as beer selection.

Side Door has a tremendous selection of beer and craft cocktails. Menu has a unique meat board for sampling as a group which was fantastic. Now the service was just okay. Friendly waitress, but our appetizers didn't show up until we had to ask for them. Which was after our meals arrived. Also the drinks took an awful long time to be crafted!Thank goodness the food and drinks were as good as they were.

Lunch this afternoon.  Unsure of what to order.  Our server Jeff explained and directed us to a outstanding lunch.  5**** server-we chose the Brussel Sprout Salad (Brussel Sprouts not one of my favs) which turned out to be...outstanding!In addition, the Prime Rib Sandwich was very good-recommend "real" horseradish on the side.  The horseradish butter was weak.Excellent lunch and the service was outstanding!Pat & Dennis

Down a star as the service really was suffering the last time we came here.  Our server seemed to be pulled in way too many directions and we had to keep flagging him down.  Maybe it was because it was the first time we actually were seated at a table?Well, whatever the reason, the next time I go, it's back to a seat at the bar for me.  That way I know the service will be spot on as those folks know what they are doing!

Tried to call in an order to go, however they won't take phone orders because they said they don't want food getting cold and additionally orders will be ready in 10 minutes. Well, they were dead on. 11 minutes after placing the order it was ready to go. I ordered the prime rib sandwich which was absolutely perfect.  Really don't know what more to say other than that.  Also ordered the avocado mash which is basically guacamole without pico that came with pita chips. Again, perfect. Flavor, texture and portions were all great. One star reduction was because it took 6 minutes sitting at the bar before I was acknowledged which was frustrating, especially on a relatively slow night. Just a heads up, the location was a bit hard to find. The address is 100 Ontario (mid block) but the actual entrance is on Rush just north of Ontario.
Great place! Loved the prime rib sandwich and the awesome beer selection! Sat at the bar and both bartenders and waitstaff were awesome.  Thanks for a great final night in Chicago! :)

Quick update...stopped in for lunch today and avoided the meat platter...ironic at a steakhouse...heheheBUT I have to say our meal was DELICIOUS!Crab dip...amaz!  I just wished it would have come with more than three small flatbread crackerslamb meatballs were amazing!!!!!veggie salad was crisp, refreshing, and crunchy.  Perfect additionpoutine...do it...just do it.  Gravy was heavenly, peppers made the dish...YUMMMMM

2 words: life-changingI haven't felt this way about a food establishment in a long time. Came here after watching a movie at the AMC Lowes 600 (just a block away) and was looking for a place to eat nearby and boy are we glad we found this place! Hubby ordered the 'Prime Rib Sandwich' and it was delectable. The thinly sliced meat just melted in your mouth, but the star of the dish was the small dish of au jus that came with it. All I was thinking was how many other dishes you could make with this small bowl of liquid. Can I have a bowl of au jus to go please?Based on the recommendation of the waiter, I ordered the 'Fork & Knife Pastrimi' and yes, you do need a fork and knife to eat it as it was messy. The pastrami is 3-weeks work of TLC and well extremely well done. At first glance, it was a big sandwich that I thought I was only able to eat 1/2 of it, but eat bit was a new savory discovery that kept my mouth wanting for more. Needless to say, I ate the whole thing!!!  It's been almost a month since my discovery of this place and I've thought about it constantly. The decor has a warm and cozy hunting lodge feel. Since they close at 10:30pm on Saturday, you don't have to deal with the loud and crazy crowd at a bar waiting for a table. We got here at 8:30pm and was seated right away. I'm a HUGE fan!
Great place for a craft beer and steak sandwich.

I've been to Side Door 3 times (drinks and appetizers with coworkers, dessert with my friends and on a blind date) and each time I've enjoyed my experience here. First off, Side Door is a 3 minute walk from my condo so by default I already liked this place. Secondly, each time I've been here I've had great service from the friendly staff working here. Thirdly, the beer menu is impressive, the food is good and the dessert hits the stop.If you love Root Beer like I do, I recommend you try the "Not Your Father's Root Beer." This beer tasted just like root beer, which is probably why I downed it in under two minutes and needed a second one.Appetizer -I'd say try the blue cheese potato chips with crispy prosciutto. You get a plate filled with chips covered in this awesome blue cheese sauce. Worth trying and you get enough to share with someone else.Food- Spiced Rubbed Leg of Lamb: the lamb comes sliced and on a board with some different dipping sauces. The lamb was tender and delicious. - House Smoked Pastrami: was pretty darn good. The sandwich comes packed with a nice portion of warm pastrami covered with this hoppy cheddar rarebit on a pretzel bun. I can see why three different waiters/waitresses recommended I try this. I enjoyed every bite of this sandwich.Dessert - Sticky Toffee Pudding: is the one to get! It's so good, but I wish a scoop of vanilla ice cream came on top of it.SideDoor is pretty awesome and I would definitely recommend this place for drinks, dinner, a quick stop for dessert or as a date spot.

This is a great date spot and really cute. We went here tonight after work and I felt a little under dressed, but the wait staff made us feel right at home.We shared and loved everything. The stuffed shrimp and poutine were delicious! I saved room for dessert and we shared the sticky toffee pudding. Also delicious.I also didn't realize we would be in for a musical treat. They had a jazzy band there that was really good. I will definitely be back to visit other items on the menu.

Love this place.... Yummy hand carved gourmet sandwiches. Craft drinks, and a cozy warm feel to the atmosphere. Great fries, and amazing meats. Great for a quick drink or pitstop for lunch. Recommended!! Come here.

Although the prime rib it was delicious, it was a shaved too thin like roast beef. The menu is limited, and although it was simply for lunch, it was very very expensive. The server was nice and the timing was great, and their chipotle deviled eggs were outstanding. But all in all, it was a little more expensive then what I was expecting. The food should been great and the prime rib should've been awesome and, well, it was just good

To start I'd like to say that the vibe of this place is pretty cool. Dim and quiet, not a lot of chatter like most places. We had a small room off the main area with a booth. The waitress was super friendly and definitely willing to share her knowledge of the everything the Sidedoor had to offer. The beer menu is eclectic to say the least, albeit a bit pricey. The calamari was an amazing starter. The fork and knife pastrami is also a a must try. We had a dessert too, but I can't remember it's name, although it was also great! I say if you're in the area, try to stop in!

SideDoor was a wonderful meal to close out a fun weekend trip to Chicago. It was fantastic to escape the tourist crowds even though this place is located right next to the bustle of the Magnificent Mile. We went right before noon on a major holiday, and there was plenty of seating immediately available. We were a little bummed that the legendary meat board had been retired from the menu, but we quickly forgot once the delicious food came out.Prime rib poutine: Great. The pickled veggies atop the plentiful meat and gravy added a lovely acidic kick to the all-around solid appetizer.Prime rib sandwich: Great. The bread was crispy, the meat was tender and plentiful, and the au jus and horseradish creme added wonderful flavor.Sticky toffee pudding: Great. This warm, rich cake paired well with the cooling taste of creme anglaise.The restaurant itself was beautifully decorated with copper tones, rich wood, and a tin ceiling. On top of that, service was extremely friendly; everyone was so warm and courteous that I thought I was back in Texas.
Very good.  I would come back again.  Fried brussell sprout salad is delicious!  So is the scalloped potatoes.  And of course the prime rib is too.

I was visiting Chicago last weekend, and yelped for the closest "Gastropub" in the area since I am a craft beer guru.  Side Door came up as first choice, so I stopped in and sat at the bar.  I was very impressed with the draft selection, they had a few rare drafts, most of them are from local breweries.  There were several IPAs on tap, and although I don't like hops, I tasted a few and they were pretty good!  I stuck with my favorite, the sour ales.  They had a fabulous sour ale by Two Brothers, "Fathom."  It was amazing.  There were several other Two Brothers selections, as well as some from Firestone Walker.  I didn't eat here, but the menu choices were so top notch, I seriously wanted to order one of everything.  The menu changes every week, so that is cool, you can always come back and get something different!  The atmosphere is prim and proper, but trendy and beautifully remodeled.  Grand staircase and high ceilings.  Reminds me of pre-prohibition type pubs.  The bartender was awesome, and all the wait staff were so friendly, they were chatting with me, giving me some history of the place and good tourist things to do while in Chicago.  Overall, 5 stars for Side Door, I hope its stil there next time I go back to Chicago so I can come again!

Excellent. Menu is small & changes, which excites me. We sat in the bar at a small round table, so can't talk about the dining room. The bar was dark, wood, some candles. Service started at a high level, but mysteriously faded as we worked through our food. Our server got injured in the kitchen, or something like that..  got a little weird at the end. Aside from that the food was superb. Except the Avacado Mash, way too heavy on the lime, skip it, maybe try the deviled eggs. Tri-meat board, potatoes, mac n cheese, asparagus, yum. The Prime Rib & the Roger sandwiches big hits. When back in Chicago, hope I can swing back by.

Random stop based solely on skimming the reviews and pictures of this place.  What a wonderful surprise!  We had pretzels, with a wonderful honey-forward mustard sauce.  Heavenly. The gf had a wedge salad, best Bleu cheese dressing either of us have ever had, and we're super picky.  I had the fork and knife pastrami, and a side of scalloped potatoes.  Maybe one bite in I was chided for cooing with utter glee at the ample am out of deliciousness placed in front of me...  apparently I was dancing in my seat.  Cocktails were exceptional and our service (weston, I believe?) couldn't have been better.  Knowledgeable, friendly, prompt, and made perfect suggestions (I know that technically falls under knowledgeable but it stands to be said individually)  If we weren't out of towners, I would probably have a labeled seat at this bar from frequency.  Bravo

This is a great gastropub with a good track record of pleasing its customers. Count me in. The small room off the bar is dark and clubby. I had a nice cocktail called a Blind Pelican made with Buffalo Trace bourbon, Aperol, lemon and rhubard bitters. Tres refreshing. The menu is mostly bites and small plates. I ordered a caesar salad made with red & green kale and white anchovies--yes, real anchovies. Followed by a board of deliciously seasoned and perfectly cooked lamb chops. These are served with little dipping sauces and caramelized onions. I can see how coming here can be quite addictive. Easy on your wallet?--no, but quite enjoyable. And the service is very fine. This is a cool retreat off Michigan Avenue, open for lunch and dinner, so head on over. I will definitely be back.
Server was AWESOME. She really knew her stuff, and her BEERS...  The food was excellent, and a great environment.. Would go back here anytime!

I had lunch recently and was pleasantly surprised! The former Lawry's sandwich bar was no frills, but tasty. Now it has ambience and delicious food.We started with the chips and Blue Cheese sauce. Decadent and yummy. I had the smoked Pastrami  with cheese sauce. So good, I have the other half stashed in my freezer for a rainy day. We shared Mac and cheese as well.Our server was great, knew the menu and made good recos.Excellent lunch spot, I will return.

This place really surprised me. I went here on Memorial Day for lunch and they were empty which worked out great because I was starving and not in the mood to wait anywhere. When you go, I recommend ordering their steak nachos. They're one of the best nachos I've ever had. The portion is large and the chips are spread out so every chip has a topping. I also tried their prime rib sandwich which was great as well. I'm curious to go back and see how their dinner is but in the meantime it's definitely a great place to go for lunch.

5 stars for our dining experience. The bar experience I would give 2 stars. Bar experience:I was standing near the server station all the way at the end of the bar because the bar was packed. My boyfriend and I just wanted to order a drink and get out of the way while waiting for our table. Sean, one of the bartenders, looked at me and in a very condescending way said, "This is our serving station. You know, where my servers pick up their drinks?" I know this and would have gladly moved out of the way when a server came up, but seeing as the bar was packed I was just looking for an open area to get a drink and move on. He proceeded to tell me to move to the other server station. Which...makes no sense. So, I go to the other server station and order a drink, which I apparently pronounced wrong, so Mr. Sean had to correct my pronunciation. He really rubbed me the wrong way and I told my boyfriend that if the rest of the experience was like this I would walk out. Dining Experience:Thankfully, our server and dining experience was FANTASTIC. Unfortunately, I cannot remember our servers name, but he was awesome. We were at a table just outside of the little kitchen area so we were able to see everything being made. Loved it! We ordered the pretzels and the baked mac and cheese to start. They were wonderful, the horseradish honey mustard with the pretzels was great! We then got the prime rib sandwich. Prime rib is one of their specialties and it was outstanding! Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and very friendly. Because of him and the dining experience, I would definitely give this place another shot. That shot will avoid the bar though.
The Chorizo Poutine was the best Poutine ever!!! The Roger sandwich was very good but the pastrami still had a lot connective tissue. The cole slaw was dope.

My sister in-law and her boyfriend were in town visiting and we found ourselves downtown without a dinner reservation. I haaaaate being downtown in general because the food tends to be overpriced and mediocre. But, thanks to Yelp, I found this place and we decided to walk over and check it out. We came in at 7pm on a Saturday night and were told it would be just a few minutes. Great! We sat in the bar area while we waited for the rest of our party to join us. The server in the bar area was fabulous and we tried the "Not Your Father's Root Beer". Yelpers, please listen: you MUST try it. It's amazing! It's root beer with a 10.7% kick. So good. When the rest of our party arrived we were sat. We had a fabulous booth for our party of six that was separated from the dining room with a tied back curtain. The little alcove made it much easier for us all to hear each other at dinner. Excellent! Our server explained that it's an open kitchen so the food will come out when it's ready so you might not get everything in an order you would prefer. That's fine though, it ensures your food is hot. I ordered the fork and knife pastrami sandwich. I will be dreaming about that sandwich for a long time. It was perfect. I sampled my sister in-law's mac and cheese and it was delicious. The only hiccup in the whole meal was when the server was clearing our plates and noticed that my sister in-law had gotten the pork tenderloin sandwich instead of the prime rib. She hadn't even notice but he gave us a complimentary dessert and adjusted our bill. Amazing service! I would not hesitate to recommend this place and my husband and I might very well make the trip back downtown specifically to go here for a date night.

I had a really great time here last night catching up with some friends. I was a little nervous they didn't take reservations, but at 7pm on a Tuesday we were seated immediately. We had our choices of still, sparkling, or ice water which was new. I thought still was the "free" one, but apparently it's ice water (#FoodieonaBudget).Our waitress was nice and gave excellent recommendations and explained the menu to us since we all have never been there before. However she was a little pushy on a salad because it was her "favorite" and she was afraid it would be taken off of the menu.The had a musician performing sad acoustic covers (the most depressing drawn out variation of Nirvana's "Teen Spirit" I have ever heard), which none of us were really into. I don't know if that's just a Tuesday night thing, but it wasn't my cup of tea.We all ordered the All Hail Kale sandwich and it was delicious. I'm not a huge kale fan but it was in an apple slaw that was awesome. Loved the bread and I ate the whole thing. I would have loved dessert, but I was too full! We also split a side of mac & cheese that was pretty good, but I wasn't into the bacon in it.Only 1 unisex bathroom which I found odd (unless there's another one that I didn't see), but overall I liked the atmosphere of this restaurant. It's definitely downtown prices, but I'd recommend splitting sides (even entrees if you want) with your group. Our waitress was able to split with 3 cards so that worked well.Ps. This is on the corner of Rush & Ontario. Go past the entry for Lawry's and turn almost as if you were going on Rush.

Mmm!  You could smell the prime rib roasting as we came in.  Lunch on a bitterly cold Sunday was fabulous.  Very nice service also.  I liked the 'English clubby' atmosphere.  The fried brussell sprout salad with candied pecans and dried cranberries with a Thai chili sauce is soooo good.  We also had the lobster mac & cheese in a truffle sauce - very creamy although not too much lobster (would have liked more).  My hubbie had the rib house sandwich with homemade chips - yummy.  Decent lunch prices for Chicago.  I would come again.

My girlfriend had a delicious cheeseburger and I had the French Onion soup. I would recommend this place if you lived in Chicago but I don't know if it will live up to its big brother Lowerys next door

I came here at an off hour on a Tuesday so me service issues. In fact the staff were exceptionally nice.  I had the prime rib steak sandwich. They slow cook the meat for hours so it's so tender you could practically eat this without using your teeth. Ask for the raw horseradish and mix it in with the jus like you mix wasabi and soy sauce. What a great dip!
Do yourself a favor and get the pastrami sandwich. It was life changing. The chipotle deviled eggs were also very good.

Discovered Side Door while Christmas shopping when we needed a break.  Sat in the bar area which is beautiful and warm on a cold day.  With 6 Chardonnay's listed on the menu was disappointed that they only had one available.  Ordered the fried Brussels sprout salad which was very good and the red chili paste dressing was amazing.  The house made chips were delicious, especially dipped in the chili paste dressing.  Great place to hang out and watch a game or just warm up.

On a recent trip to Chicago we stayed at the Intercontinental on Michigan Avenue. We had Afternoon Tea at the Langham Hotel (awesome experience) and weren't hungry until later in the evening. We looked for a restaurant that was within walking distance of our hotel.I used Yelp to locate some options. I stumbled across Side Door and looked at the menu. We decided to try it. And boy am I glad we did.It's adjacent to Lawry's Prime Rib. It's like the hipster baby cousin version. We were greeted by a gentleman with a fabulous mustache. It was like walking in to a speakeasy. The dark wood and dim lighting added to the ambience.I would say this is a very masculine restaurant. From the decor to the menu, but I'm okay with that. I just had the girliest afternoon sipping tea and eating scones. I needed some gin and meat to balance my hormones.I had a rosemary and grapefruit gin cocktail. We shared an iceberg lettuce salad. Best darn iceberg lettuce salad ever. I actually tried to recreate it when I got home.Mom had Lake Perch Fish and Chips and I had a Pastrami Sandwich with Spicy Gardinera and Cheddar sauce. It was all delicious. The only down fall was that the waiter took a long time to take our orders, because he was tending to another table.The price was affordable and the food was delicious. I truly recommend this place.

Wow what an absolute let down.  Great review great looking menu but either I hit an off night or people on Yelp need to drink a lot less before writing their reviews. The decor is very cool and hip.   Some of the staff was on the ball but our server was about the worst I have had in a LONG time and this was one of the worst dining experiences have had in years.  If you look at my other reviews you can see I eat out a lot and am fair with my reviews so take heed. From the top, we walk in about 8 on a Monday night and were seated right away. The server can over told us about the menu, well pushed on us the restaurants desire for us to by their meat board, which individual servings are 1/4lbs.  Now why I say push is that our server have the same speech to everyone seated and not only was the  "house specialty" but she recommended that we "save" bye either getting three choices for one of us or a 6 pack for the table.  Now let's do the math shall we, 6 orders X .25 lbs = 1.5 lbs meat for two of us, that would be me and my wife oh ya and a couple of sides.   Seriously!? Rule of thumbs says 1/4 to 1/2 meat per person.  Let me digress because there is SOOO much more to cover.  So we finally decide on what we want, for me Knife and fork pastrami burger on a pretzel bun, my wife the cheese burger with American with a side fries and mac N cheese to split.  I also ordered a "Not your Dad's root beer".So the drink comes and it is as advertised a root beer flavored drink with alcohol, something new but nothing I would order again.  I finish the drink and set eh glass aside, and wait... and wait... I finish my water and wait.. my wife empties her glass and we wait.... Finally after I put my 2nd empty glass (water and "beer") of to the side of the table the waitress gets the hint and fills up my water glass but doesn't offer me another drink or clear the empty one.  Now I know this may sound petty but I would like to think that there is a certain level of service all restaurants should have and drinks and used items should be removed.  I mean 99.9% of all the Chili's and Applebee's would know to clear the used stuff and offer a new drink.The food arrives (note they server you the food as it is done so things can come out of order, but they do tell you this up front) I get my burger and my wife gets hers and a minute or so later we get the sides.  Both look amazing... this is where things stopped going from ok to just flat out BAD.  My pastrami was so greasy I had to stop eating it after two bites, I honestly was worried I would get sick from the amount of grease, it was so bad that after eating a couple of bites my napkin was so greasy I had to take it off my lap for fear or staining my clothes (see picture posted), I shoved my plate off to the side and simple wasn't going to eat it.  My wife's burger was ok, average at best until she got a few bites into it and found that it was under cooked.  Now let me add to this, she asked to make sure "I want no pink in the patties", the waitress said medium well which my wife agreed to.  After about 3 - 5 minutes of my food just sitting there the waitress comes by to check on us..mind you she didn't even pick up on the fact my food was pushed off to the side with only a few bites taken.  She didn't even ask about it I told her to just take it away I couldn't eat it.  At this point I would have expected the standard question "Is there something else from the menu I can get you" but I was offered nothing.  We also asked for some ketchup for the fries then too.  Again 3-4 minutes later we flagged down the waitress and asked about the ketchup she had forgotten and then offered me something else in place of my other burger.  By this time I was just ready to go so I said no.  My wife pushed her partially uneaten under cooked burger to the side as well and we ate the boring plain overpriced fried and mac and cheese.All said and done they took the two burgers (that we didn't really eat) off the bill, the manger never came over and apologized and the waitress sort of tried but fell flat.  Summary would be nice looking place, expensive drinks (on par with most places like this) clueless staff, gross food or just boring food and a customer service level that rivals with the DMV!

This place was epic! Beautiful decor and somehow they managed to blend a classy and cozy atmosphere. The service was fantastic and everyone was super friendly. The food? Well... It was out of this world! I ordered the Fork and Knife Pastrami Sandwich and it blew my mind. I would definitely consider myself a foodie and I have had a lot of pastrami sandy's in my day but this one might take the cake! We were visiting Chicago and just so happened to stumble upon Side Door but you can beat your sweet ass that we will be hitting up this spot when come back for a visit!

Out on the town on a Saturday night and decided to grab a bite. We didn't seem to have luck finding a place that was kid friendly and with less than an hour wait. We looked on yelp and found side door! So glad that we came here! The food was superb add well as the service. Jonathan was amazing and gave us great recommendations! We had the Lawrys prime rib sandwich, the fork and knife pastrami and the pork tenderloin. .. Super delicious! Definitely coming back!

This place is owned by Lawry's, right next door & has a couple prime rib options from Lawry's on their menu.  I had the braised pork poutine & a hot fudge sundae for dessert.  Both were delicious & portion size was just right, although the sundae had too much whipped cream & not enough ice cream, which is not obvious by any of the photos here on Yelp, but still worth the try.I was there before 6 on a weekday, so no crowds, but service was still somewhat slow & a bit disorganized, especially when considering how few people were there at the time, but nothing to make you think twice about checking this place out .Would definitely recommend if you like meatier menu choices!

Can't say anything about the food but this place has the best beer selection off North Michigan Avenue. Watch for specials, like the time I came in after a Goose Island dinner and they had three different BCBS variants leftover on tap. Score!

Across from our hotel, the Marriott AC hotel, made it very convenient. Convenience is not a reason we pick restaurants but in this case, it was a good pick. Greeted when we came in the front door. Waitress was soon at our table and was very helpful as this was our first time here. The Side Bar is part of Lawry's so expect excellent prime rib. I had the prime rib sandwich was excellent. Marie had the Curry Cauliflower. Highly recommend.

Got to stop by this place for lunch today. We were seated quickly as it was not busy at all at around 1:30. The waitress was really pleasant and friendly. My brother and I ended up sharing the pulled pork poutine and a burger that had prime rib on it (sorry, not sure of the name!). Both were delicious tasting, but I have to admit it was a bit of salt overload with the combo of the two! Had to drink a lot of water, but luckily the waitress kept it full. I was very happy and very full with the meal.

Went here for dinner while in town with my boyfriend. We were just looking for something close to our location and somewhere we'd never been before. I'd like to start with the location; it's right inside another restaurant so it makes it just a bit harder to find, but I promise you it's worth the scavenge.Right off the bat, the person who seated us was great, real personable guy right along with our server. Our server went through the menu with us and was very knowledgable. I ended up getting fish and chips and my boyfriend got skirt steak which both were delicious. The fish was perfectly battered and you didn't have to worry about the batter falling off or being saggy and the fries were perfect and crisp. The skirt steak was so flavorful and came with an array of dips, horseradish, hot peppers etc. we also got the Brussels sprouts as an app which was an excellent choice. Overall great experience and already plan and going back

I was determined to find a place neither myself nor my friend had been for dinner before. It's quite a challenge when it comes to places in downtown as we were both quite into trying new places and just about every place we suggested, the other had been to. Then we found Side Door! Not only had neither of us been there but we planned on a movie post feasting and AMC was just a block from the restaurant. As soon as we walked in, we were meet with a dimly lit, semi romantic atmosphere. Tables & chairs of various sizes and comfort levels throughout the establishment. The decor reminded me of a haunted house, in a kind of strange good way. There was a giant turtle shell on one wall, huge portraits (a la Haunted Mansion at Disney World) and fancy candelabras. They have a lot on the menu that sounds absolutely delicious! Some soups and small plates were really sounding good to me but in the end I decided to go not so classy and order their grilled cheese for $10. This was a pretty intense grilled cheese! Way better than most places and I would have to bestow it the honor of being my second favorite grilled cheese in the city. It has some seriously funky cheese up in there and just like the haunted house comment, that's funky in the good way. I still have no idea what kinds of cheeses were on the sandwich but I'd venture to say it was a couple and one had some kind of seeds or something in it. It was amazing. The downfall of the sandwich was the grease. My fingers would get soaked in the oil and the napkin it rested on was soaked through. Plus it had a bit too much crispness to the bread. Overall though, I wouldn't hesitate on getting the sandwich again, but would be prepared with some extra napkins to soak the grease up.My dining companion had Lawry's Prime Rib Sandwich and gave me a bit to indulge on. I wasn't that into this sandwich. I found it to be a bit dry and just not overly exciting. Especially for $18. Just seemed a bit much for what it was - a sandwich all on its lonesome with nothing on the side.I liked Side Door, found it to be A-OK and one of the best things about it is that you're right in downtown and can get a seat. Like get a seat immediately on a Saturday night which is almost unheard of! I wouldn't balk at coming here again though I can say with confidence I'm not going to be going out of way to dine here again.

PLEASE STOP HERE!!!What a fantastic find SideDoor was. Looking for something in area a little different and they were that and more. Superb customer service from greeting to goodbye from all wait staff. Coupled with wonderful menu offering SideDoor was a great experience. Oh and by the way, the food is outstanding. Pork Belly delivered wonderful flavor and Scallops were done to perfection. My only disappointment was no room left for dessert which looked just as good.

Had lunch here while visiting Chicago.  The reviews were so great I expected much more.  The service wasn't at all what I would expect from the fact that it is a Lawry's Steakhouse Restaurant and I was seated at a small round 2-top that felt like it belonged in the bar not in the main restaurant.  Not comfortable but again maybe this is just a lunchtime setup and dinner is better.I had the salmon which was perfectly cooked and delicious but the salad was so ridiculous -- it was seemingly a grocery store bagged salad.  Why a place like this would serve a chopped iceberg lettuce salad that is heavily dressed is beyond me when creating a good lunchtime salad takes so little cost or energy.  The iced tea was watered down which again is an easy fix.  So after being here I told my friends who had planned to go to lunch the next day to keep on walking -- so many great places in Chicago to beat this. So, although the salmon was good  all the environment, service and other issues made it a negative experience for me.  I'm guessing dinner with a steak might be a good experience but you'll have to try that yourself.  I'll check back to see what you thought!

The food was great. Seriously. Everything was outstanding. 5-stars, no question. The service? Not so much. First: unless I am at a frat party bar in LP, as a server, you are allowed a maximum of 5 "bro-isms" per meal, and I think that's being generous. Please do not call me "dude," "bro," "man" or anything of the like throughout my entire meal. Second: when I order a draft, I hope to get it within 5 minutes--also generous, I think. I watched my draft sit at the server station nearly 15 minutes before I flagged down another server to get it delivered to me. Third: I had a weird interaction with my bro-server. It went like this.
